required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Building Resiliency and Vital Equity (BRAVE) Project: Understanding Native Americans' Perceptions/Beliefs About COVID-19 Testing and Vaccination Study
clinical_study.official_title: Building Resiliency and Vital Equity (BRAVE) Project: Understanding Native Americans' Perceptions/Beliefs About COVID-19 Testing and Vaccination Study

collaborator.agency: University of North Carolina at Pembroke

brief_summary.textblock: The Building Resilience and Vital Equity (BRAVE) project seeks to partner with American Indian tribal communities in North Carolina to establish COVID-19 services and resources for American Indian communities. The goal of this study is to 1) understand the barriers and social implications of COVID19 testing and vaccination among American Indians by designing and implementing culturally sensitive survey tools and intervention materials; 2) Implement BRAVE outreach and testing interventions to increase testing in American Indian communities; 3) analyze data and share back with tribal communities to improve perceptions of COVID-19 testing in the AI community and decrease in vaccine hesitancy.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants will be randomized to receive information about testing and vaccination based on zip code.
study_design_info.masking_description: No masking employed in this study.

primary_outcome.description: Survey responses to determine if participants in zipcodes selected for intervention are more less inclined to get tested for COVID-19.
Survey responses to determine if participants in zipcodes selected for intervention are more less inclined to get vaccinated against COVID-19.

arm_group.description: Survey participants in the BRAVE non-intervention arm will not have received information (e.g., informational pamplets, flyers, townhalls) about COVID-19 testing and vaccination from the BRAVE project.
Survey participants in the BRAVE intervention arm will have received information (e.g., informational pamplets, flyers, townhalls) about COVID-19 testing and vaccination from the BRAVE project.

intervention.description: This is a behavioral intervention where participants will receive cultural appropriate educational information about COVID-19 testing and vaccination.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Self reports as Native American or American Indian
Exclusion Criteria:
- Does not self-report as Native American or American Indian

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of Julius L. Chambers Biomedical/Biotechnology Research Institute
